Status asthmaticus

Status asthmaticus

Oxygen

Salbutamol

Hydrocortisone

Ipratropium

Theophylline

Magnesium

ICU - ventilation, volatiles. Unfortunately low density gases such as helium do not work because the obstruction is in the small airways where flow is laminar.

Initial ventilator settings:

I:E 1:4

MV <115 ml/kg

V T <8 ml/kg

RR 10-14/min

Inspiratory flow 80 to 100 l/min (low Ti:Te ratio)

The main problem is hyperinflation. Complications (hypotension and barotrauma) are predicted by end-inspiratory volume (Vei) above functional respiratory capacity (>20ml/kg is high risk). This can be measured by collecting total exhaled volume in a paralysed patient over 60 seconds of apnoea.

Vei can be estimated by scaling up the VT to account for the effect of intrinsic PEEP:

Vei = VT x Pplat/(Plat-PEEPi)
